titleStmt.title: E. C. Phister to William S. Botts
CWG7439

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Flemingsburg Ky
Decr 6th 1865.
Judge Wm S Botts
Dr Sir,

I have written the Enclosed petition for little Jim Strode whom you know. Ed Elston, it seems, got into the scrape on account of Jimmy who you know is as harmless and inoffensive as a child Please present it to the Governor for him and tell him about Jimmy & who the signers are

Dr Judge, Please present my enclosed Petition for the pardon of Ed. Elston & tell the Governor all you know about me and who are these who recommend the pardon. I enclose $2. to pay the fee which I understand is charged by the secrty of State or assistant Secretary for making out the pardon & applying seal
Please have it Sent to me at Flemingsburg Ky -- and oblige

Judge Wm S. Botts
Frankfort
Ky.
